title: No file listing when set "Root folders" to "/" ?
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hi,

I wanted to report that file listing seems not working anymore when setting "Avanced Settings" -> "root folders" to `/`. I did this because in this way I have a very great overview of all my audio files on my smartphone.

btw: Related to this a "Rescan" button on home screen would be very useful.

Thank you for SicMu!

PS: Unfortunately I won't be able to follow the development/the issue here. I will close my GitHub account and will move to https://gitlab.com because of https://blog.github.com/2018-06-04-github-microsoft/ (I personally don't want to support the https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embrace,_extend,_and_extinguish strategy in anyway).

title: No landscape mode outside settings?
body:
Hi,

first of all: Thank you so much for SicMu player on F-Droid. I always wanted to have a file based music player like http://mpesch3.de1.cc/1by1.html (which was unfortunately never available on F-Droid). It is  great to use!

I wanted to report that it seems that landscape mode does not work outside settings menu. I'm using a slider smartphone whcih is in landscape mode when drawing out the hardware keyboard (xt894). I think it is just a bug because landscape mode works just fine when switching to settings.

Thank you again for SicMu!

PS: Unfortunately I won't be able to follow the development/the issue here. I will close my GitHub account and will move to https://gitlab.com because of https://blog.github.com/2018-06-04-github-microsoft/ (I personally don't want to support the https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embrace,_extend,_and_extinguish strategy in anyway).

body: …ication when pausing

title: Media "Play" doesn't work when "Save song position" is enabled
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I'm using SicMu 1.2, with bluetooth headphones, and after I enabled the "Save song position" advanced setting I found I could no longer start the player by pressing "play" on my headphones.

Fast-forward / "next song" button still works, and in fact this is a workaround to start the music (and start the player, if "Media buttons auto start" is enabled) without needing to open the UI.

Pause still works, but once you've paused you need to skip to the next song or open the UI.

(workaround: disable the "Save song position" setting)

title: User interface: "help" inside "settings"
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I was commenting on bug #29 when I realized that Sicmu has a "help" page inside the "settings" page...
This doesn't look like the most natural location for the help page. (Most people, I suppose, will not get into "settings" in order to find out how to use the app).

Maybe it would be better to move the help page somewhere else?

title: Media Pause does not update notification area when SicMu is in background, shows as still playing
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Normal / as expected:

* When SicMu is in the foreground, there is no Notification, so this comment/concern does not apply.
* When SicMu starts playing __while in the background__, a notification area entry correctly appears listing the track being played.
* When SicMu moves into the background (due to the user pressing the home button, for example) a notification area entry correctly appears listing the track being played, __if a track is playing__.
* When SicMu, while in the background, starts playing a new track (due to user clicking the "next track" media button or the current track completing) the notification area entry correctly updates to the new track being played.

Unexpected:

* When SicMu, while in the background, __stops__ playing a track (because the user pauses, using a media button, or unplugs earphones), the notification area is not updated; it keeps saying "SicMu playing [some track]", and the record icon keeps rotating.

I'm using a Nokia 8 running Android 8.0.0 with bluetooth headphones, but I suspect the specifics don't matter - I've just checked with wired headphones, and the same thing happens. I'm using SicMu v1.2.

title: Anecdotal: Android battery usage tracking claims SicMu is using a lot of battery
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
This morning I decided to look at my battery usage after a few hours (new phone, new usage patterns, lots of new apps), and was very surprised to see SicMu at the top of my battery usage list, even though I at no point opened it in the 4 hours since my last full charge.

At first I thought "hmm, I enabled the possibly-non-standard media key support, maybe that's it" but looking at the manifest xml and the media intent receiver class I don't see anything clearly wrong... the only explanation there would be if my phone were getting/sending a constant stream of media intents due to some hardware flaw...?

So, no clear issue report yet, sorry, but possibly something concerning there. I'll try to check again tomorrow.

title: Feature Request: Custom "Sort"/grouping styles
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The existing sort styles are useful, but at least the latter two seem somewhat arbitrary:

   * "tree" is clear, and may be best for people (like me) who are reasonably "picky" about how their music is organized on disk.
      * (except there is no option to see track number, it is used for sort only? Or is sort by filename?)
   * "folder" at first seems clear (flattened tree / leaf folders), except it also somewhat-opinionatedly subgroups by artist (but not album??)
   * "artist" also, when compared with "folder" you would assume it has all the songs of the artist in one pile, but it turns out this one does subgroup by album.

I see the possibility of introducing a "genre" grouping is already noted in the README.md (but not todo.txt?) - it seems that making the grouping definitions customizable would be a worthwhile investment...

"Power users" would be able to add or modify their own options, and ideally even disable/hide options that don't make sense to them, somewhere in advanced settings (but the quick pick list would still be simple/uncluttered and out of the box there would still be a small number of simple options there)

title: Feature Request: Make "shuffle" option easier to reach
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I often ask my music player to play something random (across my whole collection, or across a genre), and skip from random song to random song until I find something I want to listen to at that moment. Then I typically disable shuffle (and maybe go back to the first song in the album).

SicMu makes this slightly harder than I feel it should ideally be, because it treats shuffle as a "Setting" on the separate settings page (that you then need to back out of, after having changed your selection).
I'm not sure what the best approach is to fixing this... Maybe adding a third row of quick settings on the quick popup in the corner?

title: Feature Request: More granular Repeat and Shuffle scope selection
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I only just realized that the "Repeat Group" setting also applies to Shuffle (when set to "Group", as opposed to "All" or "Track"), which is great!

What I am missing, personally, is the ability to define which grouping level that is. I have my personal music collection organized by folders as "Genre" - "Artist" - "Album", and I would love to be able to Shuffle within a Genre or Artist (without leaving the lovely tree view).

I realize the different views have different number of levels, and the "Tree" view in particular can have asymmetrical levels (different depths in different parts of the list), so this is non-trivial to implement, but I see at least two possible approaches:

   * Add a (numeric-ish) "Group Level" selector on the "Repeat Group" selection UI, so that if you choose "Repeat Group", you can choose from "which group", with options like these. "Leaf Level" would be a special value with the current existing behavior. 
      * "Leaf Level"
      * "Top Level"
      * "2nd Level"
      * "3rd Level"
      * "4th Level"
      * (more? make this a numeric selection?)
   * (and/or)
   * Introduce the concept of a "Current Selected Group" in the tree UI - so that you can see, and/or set, what group the "Shuffle" and "Repeat" behaviors are applying to - eg by long-pressing the group.

title: Portuguese localization
body:
Hello. This is a Portuguese strings.xml file. :-)

Just two observations:

- The Serbian translation has an acknoledgement to the Serbian translator. In the Portuguse translation, I only included the pt_BR transator. Do you believe it would be better to have all translators acknowledged in all langages?

- This is a pt_BR translation, but I included it inside a `values-pt` directory, becaue I think it would also be useful to other Portuguese-speaking people.

Happy New Year!

title: Check wether "Music/" directory exists before scanning it
body:
otherwise a NullPointerException is thrown.

This is *not* related to issue #24 (Doesn't find music in syncthing folder).

title: Doesn't find music in Syncthing's folder
label: [Label(name="help wanted"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Hello,

I have a Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 running crDroid (which is based on LineageOS, Android 7.1.2)
I would like to sync my music with another device using Syncthing.
But Syncthing can only synchronize files inside its own folder
(`externalSD/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/...`)
so I created a "music" folder there:

```
/storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/
```

But Sicmu won't find it, I don't know why.

I got the sources from Github, and uncommented the line that logs the
filenames being scanned (in Settings.java), compiled, installed and checked the logs:

```
    private void scanMediaFiles(Collection<File> filesToScan) {
        String[] filesToScanArray = new String[filesToScan.size()];
        int i = 0;
        for (File file : filesToScan) {
            filesToScanArray[i] = file.getAbsolutePath();
            //if (filesToScanArray[i].contains("emulated/0"))
                Log.d("Settings", "fileToScan: " + filesToScanArray[i]);
            i++;
        }

        if (filesToScanArray.length != 0) {
            MediaScannerConnection.scanFile(this, filesToScanArray, null, null);
        } else {
            Log.e("Settings", "Media scan requested when nothing to scan");
        }
    }
```

So -- when I click on "Rescan Media Files", Sicmu *does* find the files in syncthing's folder:

```
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-10-Andros_Ballos.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-07-Black_Sea_7.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-15-Versipellis_Solo_Dance_Piece.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-04-Beranche.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-14-New_Town_Klezmer.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-01-Irish_Fairy_Remember_the_Oscar_Wilde.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-03-Americana_Jam.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-08-Hobbiton_Triplets_of_Hobbitville.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-11-Egyptian_Ella.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-13-Government_Housing.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-12-Luminate_Gaels_Revenge.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-09-Shanghai_Pancakes.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-05-Patrices_Klezmer.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-02-It_Aint_Right.mp3
01-01 11:48:37.413  8365  8365 D Settings: fileToScan: /storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/music/tuo-tales-from-the-road/The_Underscore_Orkestra-06-Sail_Boat.mp3
```

However, no files from Syncthing's folder in the exteral SD card show up in Sicmu. I have waited several minutes after rescanning the media, but it did not work. I also tried killing Sicmu and even rebooting.


If I create a folder 
`/storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/XYZ/`

and include an mp3 file there, Sicmu *will* find and include it. But inside
`/storage/bb14cf63-4fcb-2231-acd6-c13f992d15e3/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/`
it seems to scan the files, but not include them.

What could be going on?

Thanks,
J.

title: Buggy sound at beggining of track on LineageOS 14.1 based on 7.1.2
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Buggy sound at beggining of new track. Possibly happens after few tracks already played. 
Sound fixes when unlock-lock screen is done. 
Tracks are read from micro sd card (lots of folders and mp3s), other players play fine. 
Buggy-choopy sound might be slow buffer. Music(sound) is distorted with small silence pauses (about 300ms long)

Importance: make SMP unusable, because need to hit lock unlock screen every time.

device: Xiaomi Hm 1s with aux jack connected. Strange, but now I'm not able to replicate it without aux cable connected. version SMP1.2 from F-droid

if you need more info ask

title: available on F-Droid?
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: Just wondering: The `README.md` writes the app is available on F-Droid – but following the link, F-Droid writes it doesn't know about it. Something missing? Maybe you could attach the `.apk` to the `releases/`, so I could grab it and put it into [my F-Droid compatible repo](https://android.izzysoft.de/repo) to make it come "true in a way" at least? Updates would then usually be available in my repo within 24h of your attaching them there (with a new tag/release, of course).

title: Missing feature: Repeat single album
body:
Hi there!

I'm a happy user of SicMu Player for a while now, well done! What I find myself missing again and again is a way to repeat the current album rather than advancing to the next one. Not only would it allow me to stick to that new album I just got my hands on, it would also protect me from jumping from [London grammar - If you wait](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SW9W1VMysgg) right into [Nonpoint - Generation Idiot](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-x3nrIy9fQk): a complete change of mood.

Any chance that could be added?

Thanks and best, Sebastian

title: In tree view empty dir should not be put into a branch but merged with parent dir
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

title: Songs could be sorted inside each folder
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hello!

I have a suggestion for SicMu.

In tree view, songs show up in some non-natural order (whatever the filesystem returns to SicMu when it asks for the files). It would be interesting to sort the audio files, so I could rename files like

```
01_one-song.mp3
02_another-song.mp3
03_one-more-song.mp3
.
.
.
```

etc, and I would then see all songs in the order I want.

I wouldn't really want a playlist-building feature... Just ordering the songs like that would already be great.

It would be very useful to have a quick access to most useful features while locked.
The default player of Android 4.4 provides this feature.

Thus: Possibility to have play/pause/mutt/prev and next button in the screenlocker would be a very useful feature.

Side note: many thanks for this player. This the best player so far most notably thanks to be folder-based. Keep up the good work!

title: Feature request: please add "folder tree" view
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Some people (like me :) ) use to organise their audio files in a folder tree/hierarchy, for example I use the first level of the tree for main categories (music, podcasts, work/teaching stuff, etc), the second level for the "author" (artist, or podcast author etc), the third level for "album" (or similar) and so on.

Now, nearly all android music players (including SMP) provide a "by folder" view, but this is a flattened list of all folders and subfolders, where the nesting/level/tree information is lost, so navigating to the desired folder is quite cumbersome, when you have hundreds of folders.

I would like to have a "folder tree" view, where I can quickly navigate from the root folder to the desired subfolder; by "tree" I don't mean it should graphically appear as a tree: it should appear as a list of folders, starting from the (user defined) root folder, just like the current "by folder" view of SMP;  clicking on each folder should present a list of its subfolders and so on, just like in traditional file managers.

title: Long press on prev/next icons doesn't seek back/forward
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: I don't know if this is a feature not implemented, or a bug on my old android 2.3 device: I would expect that a long press on the "prev" and "next" icons would seek backwards or forward in the current track (like in the standard music player). This doesn't happen: the player skips to previous/next track instead.

title: Feature request: add support for headphones button (pause, unpause, skip)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Very nice app! It would be good to have support for the headphones button, like in the standard music player: short press pauses/unpauses, long press skips to next track

title: suggestions
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
the fontsize makes it too flimsy. I tried 25-30 for the title-textview, seems ok(for me).
I think a swipe zoom would cause unexpected behavior, maybe bigger/smaller buttons in menu can do the job?

in artist view tabbing the artist should expand only the album level.

please implement  audioeffect/equalizer  as the old stockplayer does.

just my 5ct, as a 1by1 fan I like it already

title: error on start
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
must have to do with corrupted file or folder. after deleting the folder the error not longer happens. this is not reproducible.
